title: FCC's Form 477
text: Simplifying access data usually matters opinion: data kept, discarded? effectif data analysis important communicate decisions provide data’s story.

title: FCC's Form 477
text: FCC reporting Form 477 Fixed Broadband deployement. Broadband providers required fill : facilities-based broadband providers required file data FCC twice year (Form 477) offer Internet access service speeds exceeding 200 kbps least one direction.Fixed providers file lists census blocks can offer service least one location, additional information service. Source: https://www.fcc.gov/general/broadband-deployment-data-fcc-form-477 census block mentioned US census blocks 2010 vintage. Water census blocks also removed. Every row dataset matching specific services provided ISP census block. Hence ISP can provides multiple services, example different technologies different speeds census block. time period covered goes December 2014 update June December every next year december 2021.

title: FCC's Form 477
text: Broadband data FCC Form 477, data U.S. Census Bureau presented site offered free subject copyright restriction. FCC asking proper credit given: Source data: FCC Form 477 using data please follow simple guidelines. Source: https://broadband477map.fcc.gov/#/

title: FCC's Form 477
text: 477 data released multiple versions releases. took decision use ingest last release version. assuming versions consistant selecting last one help homogeneize dataset. also decided satellite data less important hence focused Fixed without satellite data. see data dictionary kept opinionated version maybe supbotimal perhaps need look implementation making sure process reliable. providing code used generated data set : data-raw/f477.R

title: FCC's Form 477
text: may notice strict data types. example FRN 10 numbers (padded 0), ie CHAR(10) sadly experience previous ingestions shown rules enforced. decided provide data instead removing rows dubious value. decisions done analyst domain expert , future revisit decisions enforce constraints data.
code: library(cori.data.fcc) library(DT)  table_with_options <- function(x){DT::datatable(x, rownames = FALSE,               extensions = 'Buttons',                 options = list(                           dom = 'Blfrtip',                           buttons = list('copy', 'print', list(                             extend = 'collection',                             buttons = c('csv', 'excel'),                             text = 'Download')                                     )                           )             )}  table_with_options(dictionary)

title: Process FCC data
text: goal cori.data.fcc facilate discovery, download uses FCC’s data. covers: National Broadband Map (NBM) data Form 477 data

title: Process FCC data
text: can install development version cori.data.fcc GitHub :

title: Process FCC data
text: basic example shows basic workflow: can also inspect available: package also provide list Provider ID FRN
code: library(cori.data.fcc)  release <- get_nbm_release() # get the available releases release #>   filing_type_id filing_type    filing_subtype #> 1         100006    Biannual December 31, 2022 #> 2         100000    Biannual     June 30, 2022 #> 3         100007    Biannual     June 30, 2023 #> 4         100011    Biannual December 31, 2023 #>                           process_uuid enable_bfm_link #> 1 bbfba324-616d-4247-ab49-933fdd97ff12            TRUE #> 2 7b81911a-c0cb-4be6-8e6c-63a32e8bf917            TRUE #> 3 59f1d8d7-e532-468a-b68f-826c7945f918            TRUE #> 4 dc5111bf-7169-40bf-bb23-f0827250cc04            TRUE #>   enable_challenge_download #> 1                      TRUE #> 2                      TRUE #> 3                      TRUE #> 4                      TRUE nbm <- get_nbm_available() # get what data is available # if we are intrested in  "Fixed Broadband" / "Nationwide" / released "June 30, 2023" nbm_filter <- nbm[which(nbm$release == "June 30, 2023" &                         nbm$data_type == "Fixed Broadband" &                         nbm$data_category == "Nationwide"), ] rownames(nbm_filter) <- NULL   # or nbm_dplyr_filter <- nbm |> dplyr::filter(release == "June 30, 2023" &                                          data_type == "Fixed Broadband" &                                          data_category == "Nationwide") all.equal(nbm_filter, nbm_dplyr_filter) #> [1] TRUE head(nbm_filter) #>       id       release       data_type technology_code state_fips provider_id #> 1 689598 June 30, 2023 Fixed Broadband               0         01        <NA> #> 2 689599 June 30, 2023 Fixed Broadband               0         04        <NA> #> 3 689600 June 30, 2023 Fixed Broadband               0         06        <NA> #> 4 689601 June 30, 2023 Fixed Broadband               0         12        <NA> #> 5 689602 June 30, 2023 Fixed Broadband               0         17        <NA> #> 6 689603 June 30, 2023 Fixed Broadband               0         18        <NA> #>                                    file_name file_type data_category #> 1 bdc_01_Other_fixed_broadband_J23_01sep2024       csv    Nationwide #> 2 bdc_04_Other_fixed_broadband_J23_01sep2024       csv    Nationwide #> 3 bdc_06_Other_fixed_broadband_J23_01sep2024       csv    Nationwide #> 4 bdc_12_Other_fixed_broadband_J23_01sep2024       csv    Nationwide #> 5 bdc_17_Other_fixed_broadband_J23_01sep2024       csv    Nationwide #> 6 bdc_18_Other_fixed_broadband_J23_01sep2024       csv    Nationwide str(fcc_provider) #> 'data.frame':    4456 obs. of  5 variables: #>  $ provider_name : chr  "@Link Services, LLC" "1 Point Communications" "101Netlink" "123.Net, Inc" ... #>  $ affiliation   : chr  "AtLink Services, LLC" "1 Point Communications" "101Netlink" "123.Net, Inc." ... #>  $ operation_type: chr  "Non-ILEC" "Non-ILEC" "Non-ILEC" "Non-ILEC" ... #>  $ frn           : chr  "0016085920" "0021352968" "0018247254" "0008590846" ... #>  $ provider_id   : num  290004 270002 190002 460000 490000 ...
